page.title: 05The Bishop's Palace
page.content: In the Churchyard the remains of an old wall can be seen .It is all that is left of the Bishop's Palace built by Gundulph Bishop of Rochester in the eleventh century.This was a good site for his palace because the Cathedral at Rochester could be easily reached by river from here. Bishops used the palace until the sixteenth century.Then it became a private residence until 1749 when it was turned into a workhouse. Gradually the building fell into disrepair and its stone was used for other buildings such as Starkey Castle at Wouldham on the other side of the River Medway. Behind the Palace Wall the remains of the old Halling to Wouldham ferry crossing points can be seen.The ferry closed in 1964 after 600 years.
